title: Academic Focuses at Macalester College
text:
Our investigation focused on how a student's declared major(s) impacts other academic focuses. For students, this can be useful to inform decision-making about potential concentrations given their declared major(s), given their benefits and accessibility. For faculty and administrators, it could be useful to be aware of the demographics of students who concentrate, so they know who to reach out to increase participation in concentrations. They also might consider changing the available concentrations or revising the requirements for existing ones.
This app was created by Lilabeth Sokolewicz, Phoebe Thomas, and Mila Zhou.
Find our interactive Shiny App here: https://lilabethsoko.shinyapps.io/FinalProjApp/
R code is included in the index section.

title: Lilabeth Sokolewicz
text:
I’m a Data science and English double major in my second year at Macalester College. As a student, I endeavor to bridge the divide between STEM and the humanities. I have taken courses involving Python, object oriented programming, data science, and statistical modeling, as well as various literature and creative writing classes.
I hail from the suburbs of Chicago, where, in my free time, you could find me either in a ballet studio or with my nose in a book. Creativity has always been important to me; I have loved stories for as long as I can remember.
My father and I had a tradition of completing my math lessons at the bookstore every week, after which I was allowed to select a new book. Eventually, I realized that I love finding stories in numbers as well as in fantastical worlds.
Nowadays, outside of the classroom, I am a captain of Macalester’s club quadball team and an avid West Coast Swing dancer.
